title: List of college rivalries in the United States
text:
This is a list of <a href="college%20rivalries">college rivalries</a> in the United States.
School rivalries are important in the United States, especially in <a href="college%20athletics">intercollegiate sports</a>. Rivalries within conferences are list below. Some rivalries, such as the <a href="Indiana%E2%80%93Kentucky%20rivalry">Indiana–Kentucky rivalry</a>, take place between two schools from different conferences.
The <a href="Caltech%E2%80%93MIT%20rivalry">Caltech–MIT rivalry</a> is unusual for both the geographic distance between the schools (their campuses are separated by about 2500 miles and are on <a href="West%20Coast%20of%20the%20United%20States">opposite</a> <a href="East%20Coast%20of%20the%20United%20States">coasts</a> of the United States) and the focus on elaborate <a href="prank">prank</a>s rather than sporting events.
By athletic conference.
ACC rivalries.
<a href="College%20basketball">Basketball</a> and <a href="College%20football">football</a> are typically the hot-button sports in the <a href="Atlantic%20Coast%20Conference">Atlantic Coast Conference</a> (ACC), though most rivalries bridge across all sports. The most notable rivalries include:
America East rivalries.
Basketball is typically the hot-button sport in the <a href="America%20East%20Conference">America East Conference</a>, though most rivalries bridge across all sports. The most notable rivalries include:
Big East rivalries.
The <a href="Big%20East%20Conference">Big East Conference</a>, founded as a <a href="college%20basketball">basketball</a> conference, is a league of 11 <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I">Division I</a> schools, with only UConn playing <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20Football%20Bowl%20Subdivision">FBS</a>–level <a href="college%20football">football</a>. The conference, while centered in the northeast, is also geographically diverse, stretching from Nebraska to New England. Current rivalries include:
Big Ten rivalries.
Universities in the <a href="Big%20Ten%20Conference">Big Ten Conference</a> in the Midwest have more rivalries than Universities in the Southeast.
Big 12 rivalries.
Current rivalries in the <a href="Big%2012%20Conference">Big 12 Conference</a> include:
Other current rivalries involving Big 12 schools include:
Former Big 12 rivalries that are now dormant due to <a href="2010%E2%80%9314%20NCAA%20conference%20realignment">conference realignment in the early 2010s</a> include:
Colonial Athletic Association rivalries.
Rivalries in the <a href="Colonial%20Athletic%20Association">Colonial Athletic Association</a> (CAA) include:
Ivy League and service academy rivalries.
Rivalries between and among the <a href="Ivy%20League">Ivy League</a> schools and the <a href="United%20States%20Service%20academies">service academies</a> include:
Pac-12 rivalries.
The <a href="Pac-12%20Conference">Pac-12 Conference</a> falls neatly into six regional pairings, leading to strong natural rivalries. Three of these pairs are cross-state rivals, one pair is within the same metropolitan region (<a href="San%20Francisco%20Bay%20Area">San Francisco Bay Area</a>), and one pair vies for bragging rights within the same city (Los Angeles).
Other Pac-12 rivalries:
Additional non-conference rivalries involving Pac-12 schools (the most famous of which is arguably Notre Dame-Southern California) can be found in other sections of this article.
SEC rivalries.
Rivalries in the <a href="Southeastern%20Conference">Southeastern Conference</a> (SEC) include:
Notre Dame rivalries.
The <a href="University%20of%20Notre%20Dame">University of Notre Dame</a> (an <a href="NCAA%20Division%20I%20FBS%20independent%20schools">independent in football</a>) has numerous <a href="Notre%20Dame%20Fighting%20Irish%20football">football</a> rivals, the most notable of which include:
Additionally, <a href="Notre%20Dame%20Fighting%20Irish%20men%27s%20basketball">Notre Dame men's basketball</a> has traditional rivalries with <a href="DePaul%20Blue%20Demons%20men%27s%20basketball">DePaul University</a>, <a href="Marquette%20Golden%20Eagles%20men%27s%20basketball">Marquette University</a>, and <a href="UCLA%20Bruins%20men%27s%20basketball">UCLA</a> when each of the programs met regularly and were national contenders. <a href="Notre%20Dame%20Fighting%20Irish%20women%27s%20basketball">Notre Dame women's basketball</a> has developed <a href="Notre%20Dame%E2%80%93UConn%20women%27s%20basketball%20rivalry">a nationally significant rivalry</a> with the <a href="UConn%20Huskies%20women%27s%20basketball">University of Connecticut</a>, with <a href="Bird%20at%20the%20Buzzer">a published book</a> focusing on one specific matchup.
By region.
Southeastern rivalries.
Universities in the Southeastern U.S., including those in the <a href="Atlantic%20Coast%20Conference">Atlantic Coast Conference</a> (ACC), <a href="Conference%20USA">Conference USA</a> (C-USA), <a href="Mid-Eastern%20Athletic%20Conference">Mid-Eastern Athletic Conference</a> (MEAC), <a href="Southwestern%20Athletic%20Conference">Southwestern Athletic Conference</a> (SWAC), <a href="Southeastern%20Conference">Southeastern Conference</a> (SEC), <a href="Southern%20Conference">Southern Conference</a> (SoCon), <a href="Southland%20Conference">Southland Conference</a>, and <a href="Sun%20Belt%20Conference">Sun Belt Conference</a>, have perhaps the most complex jumble of rivalries, many associated with annual football games, and often with colorful nicknames:
Old Southeastern rivalries seldom played due to conference obligations, divisional changes etc.:
Texas rivalries.
These rivalries involve Texas schools that are not currently members of the <a href="Big%2012%20Conference">Big 12 Conference</a>. In two of these rivalries, both sides involved were members of the old <a href="Southwest%20Conference">Southwest Conference</a>, four of whose schools were founding members of the Big 12. Another rivalry involves an old SWC team against an Oklahoma rival.
